docs.snippet: As Facebook undergoes a renovation focused on improving its users’ well-being, the company could take inspiration from an app it already owns.

headline.print_headline: The App Facebook Aims to Be, It Already Owns
headline.main: What if a Healthier Facebook Is Just … Instagram?

docs.snippet: Crossword constructors, looking to boost contributions by women and people of color, offer their services

headline.print_headline: New Facebook Group Helps Aspiring Constructors Learn the Art of Puzzle Making
headline.main: New Facebook Group Helps Aspiring Constructors Learn the Art of Puzzle Making

docs.snippet: The changes the social network recently made to its news feed has some advertisers thinking there will be opportunities for growth in video.

headline.main: As Facebook Changes Its Feed, Advertisers See Video Ambitions

docs.snippet: Facebook said it planned to prioritize high-quality news on its site by allowing its users to rank news sources that they see as the most credible and trustworthy.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Will Let Users Rank Credibility of News
headline.main: Facebook to Let Users Rank Credibility of News

docs.snippet: The company said its previous investigation had been too narrow, centering on accounts already identified by American intelligence agencies.

headline.main: Facebook to Take Broader Look at Possible Russian Role in Brexit Vote

docs.snippet: But will Mark Zuckerberg be any good at social engineering?

headline.print_headline: Facebook Doesn’t Like What It Sees in the Mirror
headline.main: Facebook Doesn’t Like What It Sees When It Looks in the Mirror

docs.snippet: In the next few weeks, you will see fewer viral videos and news articles from media companies, and instead see more posts that include interactions between you and the people you know.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Feed Shifting Focus To Genial Ties
headline.main: Facebook Overhauls News Feed to Focus on What Friends and Family Share

docs.snippet: Mark Zuckerberg’s return to focusing more on their welfare of Facebook’s users may limit short-run profits but should improve sustainability.

headline.main: New Facebook Should Benefit Investors Long Term: DealBook Briefing

docs.snippet: Last fall, the online giant altered what people in six nations see. Established news sites said their web traffic declined, adding that more bogus stories were shared instead.

headline.print_headline: Test Countries For Facebook Illustrate Risk
headline.main: In Some Countries, Facebook’s Fiddling Has Magnified Fake News

docs.snippet: The social network has implemented major changes to the types of posts, videos and photos that appear in your News Feed. Here is what you should expect.

headline.main: Facebook Is Changing. What Does That Mean for Your News Feed?
